You could make them sign it, but at that point, you are adding a new protocol, and it would pretty much look like EigenDA.

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> I am not too worried about this because the vector comes at significant orphan risk cost to the proposer

author: potuz
content:
I think it's zero risk to the proposer depending on client implementation. Currently at least the only client I'm aware of, doesn't check blob index against the block but rather against the Max so anyone proposing can add invalid blobs for free that will be propagated and not penalized by anyone. You guys seem pretty certain that this is fine but to me it looks like every 12 seconds that we don't have 6b blobs on a block, the proposer can gossip some extra data and be sure that 1) the p2p network will gossip it without any penalization and 2) clients may keep that useless data for some time. 

Now I give you that I don't know how to exploit this in any meaningful way, but it doesn't take away the fact that both of these are there and we know that anything that the network offers will be taken

author: potuz
content: Just to be clear: there's zero risk of orphaning if you publish your block early with 3 commitments and then submit 6 blobs
